author: Michael Larabel
description: The Arch Linux based CachyOS has been quite popular with Linux gamers and enthusiasts for offering leading out-of-the-box performance, especially following the shutdown of Intel's Clear Linux. CachyOS has developed quite a following on the Linux desktop while looking ahead to 2026 they will be working on a server edition...
title: Arch Linux Powered CachyOS To Develop A Server Edition

author: Michael Larabel
description: As a wonderful Christmas gift to open-source fans, NVIDIA dropped their proprietary license on the CUDA Tile intermediate representation and has now made the IR open-source software...
title: NVIDIA CUDA Tile IR Open-Sourced

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Linux 6.19 kernel has been a bit bumpy in the scheduler department but at least one fix is on the way for addressing fallout...
title: Fix On The Way For One Of The Linux 6.19 Regressions: 52.4% Scheduler Regression

author: Michael Larabel
description: For X11/X.Org fans there is a new Christmas surprise: Phoenix as an in-development X Server written from scratch using the Zig programming language...
title: Phoenix: A New X Server Written From Scratch With Zig

author: Michael Larabel
description: When it came to the most viewed AMD Linux/open-source news of 2025 there were a lot of accomplishments for the company this year both on the CPU and graphics side of the house and from consumer to server hardware. Today is a look back at the most popular Intel open-source/Linux news of the year, which unfortunately, their layoffs and other cuts to their software engineering were attracting a lot of interest...
title: The Death Of Clear Linux, Other Intel Linux Engineering Setbacks In 2025

author: Michael Larabel
description: Google's Propeller is a profile-guided, reflinking optimizer for large codebases. Propeller is built atop LLVM and can allow for whole-program optimizations. Google compiler engineers are now hoping to bring the Propeller tool into the upstream LLVM codebase...
title: Google Looks To Upstream Its Propeller Tool To LLVM For More Performance

author: Michael Larabel
description: The mainline Linux kernel already supports several different Mobileye SoCs for that company focused on self-driving tech and advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS). Consulting firm Bootlin has been working on bringing their latest SoC, the Mobileye Eyeq6Lplus, to the mainline Linux kernel...
title: Mobileye Eyeq6Lplus SoC Support Being Worked On For Mainline Linux Kernel

author: Michael Larabel
description: The past several years we have seen new releases of the Ruby programming language implementation for Christmas (25 December). This year is no different with Ruby 4.0 having been released this morning...
title: Ruby 4.0 Released With Ruby Box Experimental Feature, ZJIT Compiler
